alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 1:04PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 145 PM CDT... At 104 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brilliant, or 8 miles north of Winfield, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Haleyville, Brilliant, Lake Buttahatchee and Piney Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
